meanings.definition: To treat or combine with ozone.
meanings.sent1: The scientist decided to ozonise the water to make it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician will ozonise the air to remove any harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to ozonise the ingredients to give the dish a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to ozonise her room with positivity and good vibes.
meanings.sent5: The gardener used a special machine to ozonise the soil for better plant growth.

meanings.sent1: The machine can ozonise oxygen to create ozone for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The chemical reaction will ozonise the molecules into ozone gas.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could ozonise ordinary air into pure ozone.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity seemed to ozonise the room with inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The storm's intensity seemed to ozonise the atmosphere with electricity.
